---------------------------------


General Rules

1. Site-wide rules apply
2. This is a Normal Game
3. Do not quote your role PM or any Quick Topics
4. Do no use unusual text size or format
5. I reserve the color ORANGE, do not use it.
6. Do not discuss the game outside of this thread
7. Do not discuss the game outside of this thread (I am putting this twice because of the recent sticky)

Activity Rules

1. Give notice for V/LA and indicate the time period it will be for.
2. If you have not posted in 72 hours, you will be prodded
3. Failure to post within 24 hours of a prod will result in your replacement.
4. Four prods and you're replaced.
5. Days will last 14 real world days and nights will last 72 real life hours.

Voting

1. Lynches result from %50 + 1 votes.
2. Only votes in the BOLD or VOTE tags will count
3. If there is no majority at a day end deadline, no lynch will occur
4. Do NOT post the day after your lynched or killed, not even for a "darn it!" post.

God Mod Rule

1. If I say it, it is law until I say otherwise.


Example Role PM:

You are a VANILLA TOWNIE

-Your power is your vote and your voice

-You win when all threats to the town are eliminated

ROLE PMs GOING OUT SHORTLY. Stand by...

ROLE PMs OUT! Day 1 starts when I've received 11 of 13 confirms.

11/13 Confirmed

Giving the remaining 2 until the 48 hour mark from when the roles were sent to pick them up.

I'd appreciate answers, and I don't understand the motivation for refusing.

Scum can be caught because players do one thing as town and another thing as scum. However, this split manifests differently in players depending on their personality. Therefore, knowing as much as possible about players is essential for calibrating gut reads. The RQS doesn't itself produce much alignment revealing content, but it does reveal useful information about players. There's information in how people respond, even if the content proves trivial.

This is Day 1. You're not going to have any hard proof that early. So you're left with knuckleheads(or possible Scum?) willing to vote for no good reason.

"moron"

I'm not new to Mafia. I have five years of experience, and many games played and hosted simultaneuously. I will share with you my reads, but please keep in mind that all of it is speculation. I'll also use a point system of -10 to 10 to help try and quantify in some way my feelings among players at this point. "-10" is the greatest feeling that one is Scom. "10" is the greatest feeling that one is Town. "0" is a null read.

Albert B. Rampage ~ 0. He's only posted once, and it was a random vote. Null so far.

theaceofspades ~ -1. In (5) he voted randomly; null read on that. However, in (43), he declined to answer the 1st part of archaebob's questions in full. He should have some rough estimate of how much experience he has.

jackofspades ~ +1. He random'd in (6), and answered archaebob's question fully (16). He then went and asked if others would do so. That makes me feel slightly that that's a Town thing to do. He then votes for Squilly in (89), and questions why he voted for Smoker (that said, I placed my bluff vote on Smoker earlier on). I have a slight Town read on him.

Naomi-Tan ~ 0. I love the name Naomi. It's cute. Anyways, she random'd in (8) for theaceofspades. She refused to answer this 1st part of archaebob's question in (37), because "I think this question could be used by scum to work out who is weaker and better alive late game, so im not gonna answer it." I have mixed feelings on this, but my gut tells me this sentiment is more right than wrong. Curiously, in (59) Naomi asked "wait... why is he being paranoid?," which doesn't make sense because I never explicitly said Nic was being paranoid, but that in general activity is good for Town and paranoia isn't. A good many VTs and PRs have been hung due to paranoid Townies. Her feathers are a bit ruffled due to my abrasive (yet effective) nature (88). I'm only abrasive in Mafia. Catch "Wake" on usmessageboards.com and you'll find me to be quite the gentleman. I'm getting a null read on her.

archaebob ~ +2. RV'd in (13). Offered up a 3-part question in (14). Then he pined for more people to answer his question, and also gave some general gameplay thoughts in (24). May be helpful Town. Or not. Slight Town read.

hodge ~ 0. RV'd Salmonella Dreams. That's it. Null read.

Squilly ~ -1. RV's 3 seperate times. No explanation at all. Slight Scum read.

aptil ~ +3. RV'd in (19). Initially questioned how the RQS helped, and says "It maybe a conversation starter in early game but surely nothing that will help us with scum hunting." I'm unsure what to think of it at that point. However, he then asks Squilly why he voted for jackofspades in (23). Slight Town read there. He later answers his question in full in (26). That nullifies the earlier feeling of uncertainty; slight Town read. He then obliges jack's question of what to do while hunting, which is, as well, helpful. He also implies/asks Nic in (33) and (38) on how Nic hadn't voted for someone but was wanting a wagon to ensue (If I've got this wrong, aptil, please let me know). In (83) he questions Antihero on his hapless vote for me. (86): "I thought getting reactions out of people was a good thing." He is right, and Antihero is not. He has 16 posts thus far, and has contributed a bit. So, I have a Town read on him.

NicCage and SalmonellaDreams ~ 0. I'm not on good terms with Nic at this point, so I'm not sure I can give a fair reading on them. We've explained our sides already. If anyone wants to hear my reads on them, I'll do so when I can.

Antihero ~ -1. Voted for me in (82). He doesn't really explain his vote, but, like people do when they haven't read things through, he makes a rather dumb comment about me. Apparently he's ignorant. He later unvotes in (99), which is after I've started typing up this post. He felt so certain earlier, yet he then turned on a dime. I'd like to hear him explain himself. I've got a slight Scum read on him right now, but if he explains himself and otherwise tries to be helpful and willing to listen, my impression of him will likely change.

Radiant Cowbells ~ 0. She hasn't posted yet. But, I do know that in another game with JasonWazza she hammered herself rather angrily Day 1, and she was the Town Doctor. Keep that in mind, please.

And before I forget, with him gone I'll UNVOTE: Smoker.

I'll happily explain to you why explaining town reads is anti-town though!

There's a couple of reasons. 1) If you explain your town reads in a game, it's very easy for scum to try and manipulate your read on them using the reasons you explained earlier. Alternatively, if you try and scum read them for doing exactly that, they can claim you have cognitive dissonance and likely get away scot free.

2) When you explain town reads, you are encouraging discussion about them. This kind of discussion leads to the ability for scum to provide free content. (For example, if I explained my town read on aptil, it would give the scum the potential to discuss my read/case without opening themselves up.)

3) If you discuss your town read on someone, it lowers your ability to push them for reactions later in the game. No read is ever 100% guaranteed correct.

This is my first game in over a year. I used to come into Day 1 as an instigator, never as deliberately rude as Wake, but similarly convinced that the key to generating content was to elicit emotional reactions from people. I was very quick to believe that I had uncovered all of the scum in the first 25 pages of a game, and was more than happy to browbeat the town into following my lead. They often did. We often lost. I was almost always unlynchable and high up on people's town lists, but I was also frequently wrong, and my play was very polarizing to the games I was in. For these reasons, my town record is actually pretty bad.

I've returned to mafia after a turbulent year of heartbreak and epiphany to see if I am now equipped to break into that top tier of play. There's aspects of my old town meta that I've identified as egocentric in their motivation, and that I'm persuaded I can do without. I've read over Vi's guide a lot. I'm fascinated by the quietness of Albert's new meta (my guess is that his arc as a player is not too different from mine). What you've seen has been my attempt to reconcile all of these different considerations with what I still think are important priorities Day 1.

You can make fun of me for being a hopeless, sophomoric romantic all you want, but let's get real here, who are you kidding? You've got a penchant for graffiti art, pokemon, and quirky usernames. Your interest in mafia is overtly psychological and literary. "Method acting" is in your active vocabulary. You're fascinated by people and their veneers, and you've singled me out because you think I have one and you want to be the person to tear it down. You've noted that my beat down of Wake can be read as an open letter to myself. I suspect this charade you're playing with me follows a similar principle.

So let's cut the BS. You don't have a case, except to suggest that I'm enough of a genius to be pulling things off as scum. You've correctly ascertained (look at you go) that by a hairline my play is self-conscious, and you've decided to dedicate your focus to provoking that one little sliver of my psyche. This is a task which despite your alignment you can pursue organically because you genuinely believe you're onto something and you think it'll probably read that way. After all, this is why you play mafia, to use your unique command of empathy to make the case that nobody else is equipped to make. Right now, it enables you to plausibly tunnelvision, because after all, if I'm actually scum and you are the only person who is sufficiently artsy to realize it, you've gotta act now before you get lynched or night killed. You can sell that to the town and it's not an explicitly inconsistent narrative.

The truth, Banksys, as I'm afraid we both know, is that you're scum. You're deliberately picking on someone whose position in the town is secure, not so much as a scum maneuver to dislodge him, but more because it's an edgy and confident thing to do. And after a train wreck Day 1 in which most people here have (despite your efforts to simulate spontaneity) developed scum gut reads on you, going after me is your best bet to active lurk away the end of the day. My argument about her tone is that it's choppy. Contrived. She's a smart player, so you're never going to see a slam dunk tell from her. What you will see a lot in smart scum is a stitched-together quality in their thought process and reactions. They write things for effect. What they do doesn't line up with what they say. Or it lines up completely, in a kind of preplanned way. Also, what they say doesn't line up with how they're saying it. It's a subtle thing, and it's really just a question of putting yourself in their shoes, trying to imagine yourself with their personality, and seeing whether what they're doing lines up more with what you'd expect from town or scum. In the case of Banksys, I see scum all over, because I'm constantly reminded of things I've done or felt tempted to do as scum. I feel it on my skin.

I'm really not sure about LadyL. Yeah, she doesn't explain stuff, which comes with certain advantages and disadvantages for town. Among the disadvantages of playing that way is that if for whatever reason you start to trigger scum gut reads you're in a poor position to defend yourself. At the moment I'm inclined to think that she's town, because her reads largely agree with mine. I also don't think that flying off the handle is a scum tell. At all. So, while I understand some of the motivation behind the wagon, I don't think she's the best Day 1 lynch.

I don't buy any of Nacho's reasoning, especially since he hasn't answered my question about his initial Banksys vote.

Spoiler: Breaking Bad
Skyler: "You look terrible."

Walt: "But, I feel good."

This is ultimately a guy that put himself and his goals ahead of all the people that were important to him in his life.

It's exactly as Mike said..."you had to be the man, you and your ego"

He would not accept Gretchen and Eliott's money to save his family from financial doom. He had to get a taste of what it was to be in control of his own destiny, unafraid of death or cancer, to sleep soundly at night and be ready for what the next day may bring...and he got addicted to it.

He was in a nice spot. If he got away with it, he would be loved by his kids, who he provided for. If he got caught, he would be remembered as a famous criminal like Jesse James. If he was shot, well, he knew he deserved it anyway.

My favorite moment in the finale was when Walt was finally honest.

"Skyler, you've got to understand...all I did..."

"I did it for me. I liked it. I was good at it. And I was really...I was alive."

That was cathartic.

And it sums up the series perfectly for me. A guy haunted by his mistakes and a chip on his shoulder, going through life with a sentiment of unrealized potential. When he faces his own death, he decides to take control of his life. And he succeeds at a very high cost. He ruined his family's life, was responsible for so many deaths, hurt and damage, but he went into that final showdown knowing that he did his best to undo some small portion of all the bad he did before his inevitable death.

What a way to go.
